page.title: 10BUDGENOR LODGE
page.content: {Budgenor Lodge}was built in 1794 and was known as the{Easebourne Union.}It was taken over by the London authorities in 1830 and became known as the{Workhouse.}In 1950 it was turned into an{Old People's Home}and was used as such for over twenty years. In the late 1970's the Sussex County Council took over and used it to accommodate the homeless. Budgenor Lodge can accommodate 30 families in small units, the sizes of which vary according to the size of the family. Each unit contains a sink, wardrobe and cooker. In the case of unmarried mothers a bathroom and kitchen are shared. A dormitory is available for "gentlemen of the road". The average length of time for which people can stay at the Lodge varies from six to nine months.
